adc_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

ADC example driver for AVR32 UC3.

This file provides an example for the ADC on AVR32 UC3 devices.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with an ADC
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file adc_example.c.

#include "board.h"
#include "print_funcs.h"
#include "gpio.h"
#include "pm.h"
#include "adc.h"

00123 {
00124   // GPIO pin/adc-function map.
00125   static const gpio_map_t ADC_GPIO_MAP =
00126   {
00127     {EXAMPLE_ADC_TEMPERATURE_PIN, EXAMPLE_ADC_TEMPERATURE_FUNCTION},
00128     {EXAMPLE_ADC_LIGHT_PIN, EXAMPLE_ADC_LIGHT_FUNCTION},
00129 #if BOARD == EVK1100
00130     {EXAMPLE_ADC_POTENTIOMETER_PIN, EXAMPLE_ADC_POTENTIOMETER_FUNCTION}
00131 #endif
00132   };
00133 
00134   volatile avr32_adc_t *adc = &AVR32_ADC; // ADC IP registers address
00135 
00136   signed short adc_value_temp = -1;
00137   signed short adc_value_light = -1;
00138 #if BOARD == EVK1100
00139   signed short adc_value_pot = -1;
00140 #endif
00141 
00142   // Assign the on-board sensors to their ADC channel.
00143   unsigned short adc_channel_temp = EXAMPLE_ADC_TEMPERATURE_CHANNEL;
00144   unsigned short adc_channel_light = EXAMPLE_ADC_LIGHT_CHANNEL;
00145 #if BOARD == EVK1100
00146   unsigned short adc_channel_pot = EXAMPLE_ADC_POTENTIOMETER_CHANNEL;
00147 #endif
00148 
00149   int i;
00150 
00151 
00152   // switch to oscillator 0
00153   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00154 
00155   // init debug serial line
00156   init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00157 
00158   // Assign and enable GPIO pins to the ADC function.
00159   gpio_enable_module(ADC_GPIO_MAP, sizeof(ADC_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(ADC_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00160 
00161   // configure ADC
00162   adc_configure(adc);
00163 
00164   // do a loop
00165   for (;;)
00166   {
00167     // slow down operations
00168     for ( i=0 ; i < 1000000 ; i++);
00169 
00170     // display a header to user
00171     print_dbg("\x1B[2J\x1B[H\r\nADC Example\r\n");
00172 
00173     // get value for first adc channel
00174     adc_enable(adc,adc_channel_temp);
00175     adc_start(adc);
00176     adc_value_temp = adc_get_value(adc, adc_channel_temp);
00177     adc_disable(adc,adc_channel_temp);
00178     // display value to user
00179     print_dbg("HEX Value for Channel temperature : 0x");
00180     print_dbg_hex(adc_value_temp);
00181     print_dbg("\r\n");
00182 
00183     // get value for second adc channel
00184     adc_enable(adc,adc_channel_light);
00185     adc_start(adc);
00186     adc_value_light = adc_get_value(adc, adc_channel_light);
00187     adc_disable(adc,adc_channel_light);
00188     // display value to user
00189     print_dbg("HEX Value for Channel light : 0x");
00190     print_dbg_hex(adc_value_light);
00191     print_dbg("\r\n");
00192 
00193 #if BOARD == EVK1100
00194     // get value for third adc channel
00195     adc_enable(adc,adc_channel_pot);
00196     adc_start(adc);
00197     adc_value_pot = adc_get_value(adc, adc_channel_pot);
00198     adc_disable(adc,adc_channel_pot);
